headline.0: Q&A with Rosanna Flamer-Caldera: Long-time Activist Talks LGBT Rights, From 1970s San Francisco to Sri Lanka Today
headline.1: Thirteen Years in the Making: Michèle Stephenson and Joe Brewster Talk About Their Film American Promise
headline.2: UN Decries 'Slow, Uneven' Use Of Law Protecting Afghan Women

short_description.0: LGBT people have faced extreme discrimination in Sri Lanka. For more than a century, the country has outlawed same-sex relationships under its colonial-era "gross indecency" laws.
short_description.1: One of the enduring hopes of the digital age is that technology can break down the barriers between peoples and races. A film thirteen years in the making, American Promise follows two African-American boys from first grade through high-school, showing the challenges and opportunities young black men face in today's education system.
short_description.2: Women have since won back rights to education and work, but there are fears these freedoms are shrinking as NATO-led forces
